intro: Gouania virgata, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety pubescence. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Gouania virgata is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and waste areas due to its adaptability and rapid growth.
